job_description: The Data & Analytics Analyst Intern will contribute to Trust Science's ambitious growth initiatives, shaping the future of financial services through strategic insights and innovative thinking.
responsibilities: Apply data science and data analytics techniques to support business analytics projects.
Develop, evaluate, and refine decisioning flows and credit risk strategies.
Assist in the development, validation, documentation, deployment, and monitoring of machine learning models used in the consumer lending industry.
Assess model adequacy and appropriateness based on business objectives, assumptions, and performance.
Identify and evaluate predictive attributes for credit decisioning and fraud detection.
Design, implement, and optimize model and credit monitoring dashboards to provide actionable insights.
Ensure dashboards meet client-specific requirements and align with organizational goals.
Leverage up-to-date data science techniques to enhance credit monitoring and evaluation processes.
Stay current with industry technology and best practices in credit risk management, data visualization, and decision strategy implementation.
Manage time-sensitive projects and deliverables independently with a focus on accuracy and attention to detail.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align project outcomes with business objectives.
Partner with internal and external stakeholders to refine credit monitoring strategies.
Prepare clear, data-driven reports and presentations for decision-makers.
Identify areas for process improvement and implement innovative solutions.
Monitor the performance of dashboards and decision-making models, making necessary adjustments to maintain effectiveness.
Other projects and/or duties as assigned by your Supervisor from time to time.
requirements: Currently pursuing a Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, or a related field (strong applicants at the senior undergraduate level may also be considered).
Strong programming experience in Python for data analysis, machine learning, and automation.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and manipulating large datasets.
Solid understanding of machine learning techniques and experience working with structured and unstructured data.
Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to independently identify and address challenges effectively and efficiently.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.
Team-oriented mindset, with the ability to collaborate effectively while also working independently.
Analytical and strategic thinker who is eager to learn and contribute to meaningful projects.

education_required.field_of_study: Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, or a related field
